newsitem.title: USA: PETsMART comfortable with Q2 EPS estimates $0.09.
newsitem.headline: PETsMART comfortable with Q2 EPS estimates $0.09.

text.p: PETsMART Inc said Thursday it is comfortable with earnings estimates of $0.09 a share for its second quarter and $0.55 a share for fiscal 1998.
Late Wednesday the retailer said net income from operations for its first quarter would be about $0.05 a share, below the First Call consensus estimate of $0.08 a share.
"We're comfortable with the $0.09 estimate for the second quarter and ... we are comfortable with $0.55 a share (for the year)," chief financial officer Susan Schnabel told Reuters in an interview.

In its statement Wednesday the company said it experienced a number of problems during the first quarter including inventory management, a slump in sales of flea and tick products as well as unsuccessful advertising activities.
Analysts said the biggest factor behind the weaker than expected earnings was badly managed inventories which accounted for about two-thirds of the earnings shortfall.
"We made some misguided decisions in hindsight," Schnabel said. "Everyone clearly has one mission in life and that is to solve the problem."
Schnabel admitted that management was distracted from the day-to-day running of the company.

"There have been allegations that management was too busy on integrating acquisitions and I would be deceiving you if I told you management wasn't doing that," she said adding that management needs to focus itself on basics.
"It certainly is being addressed and agressively addressed."
